title: Fullscreen not working for most resolutions

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Bug reports and bugfix pull requests

body:
GLFW reports various valid video modes on a Mac Book Pro Retina 15" early 2013:

```
640x480
800x600
1024x768
1280x800
1440x900
1680x1050
2048x1280
2560x1600
2880x1800
```

The first issue is that not all possible resolutions are reported. Here's what the display really supports according to SwitchResX, which also allows setting those modes:

![http://libgdx.badlogicgames.com/uploads/Screen%20Shot%202016-01-03%20at%2023.04.36-IOKaSoTsRz.png](http://libgdx.badlogicgames.com/uploads/Screen%20Shot%202016-01-03%20at%2023.04.36-IOKaSoTsRz.png)

As a test, i simply modified [simple.c](https://github.com/glfw/glfw/blob/master/examples/simple.c#L89), passing in any of the video mode resolutions that GLFW reports. Here's the results for various resolutions set in line 89, using the primary monitor:

800x600
![http://libgdx.badlogicgames.com/uploads/Screen%20Shot%202016-01-03%20at%2023.08.17-cGh6gJ3lSa.png](http://libgdx.badlogicgames.com/uploads/Screen%20Shot%202016-01-03%20at%2023.08.17-cGh6gJ3lSa.png)

1280x800
![http://libgdx.badlogicgames.com/uploads/Screen%20Shot%202016-01-03%20at%2023.09.25-wPQnDQ5anU.png](http://libgdx.badlogicgames.com/uploads/Screen%20Shot%202016-01-03%20at%2023.09.25-wPQnDQ5anU.png)

1440x900
![http://libgdx.badlogicgames.com/uploads/Screen%20Shot%202016-01-03%20at%2023.10.23-5ClAKXH3FU.png](http://libgdx.badlogicgames.com/uploads/Screen%20Shot%202016-01-03%20at%2023.10.23-5ClAKXH3FU.png)

1680x1050
![http://libgdx.badlogicgames.com/uploads/Screen%20Shot%202016-01-03%20at%2023.12.09-eKMd9CKkAH.png](http://libgdx.badlogicgames.com/uploads/Screen%20Shot%202016-01-03%20at%2023.12.09-eKMd9CKkAH.png)

2880x1800
![http://libgdx.badlogicgames.com/uploads/Screen%20Shot%202016-01-03%20at%2023.13.04-ZKSGzdRuxg.png](http://libgdx.badlogicgames.com/uploads/Screen%20Shot%202016-01-03%20at%2023.13.04-ZKSGzdRuxg.png)

Only 1440x900 and 2880x1800 work. This seemed a bit to convenient (the latter being a multiple of the former), so i checked my system settings. Low and behold:

![http://libgdx.badlogicgames.com/uploads/Screen%20Shot%202016-01-03%20at%2023.13.50-aX6cYaLdof.png](http://libgdx.badlogicgames.com/uploads/Screen%20Shot%202016-01-03%20at%2023.13.50-aX6cYaLdof.png)

It looks only resolutions that are a multiple of the currently set screen resolution work. To test this theory, i set the current scaled resolution to this:

![http://libgdx.badlogicgames.com/uploads/Screen%20Shot%202016-01-03%20at%2023.14.31-0SrT1qWnRp.png](http://libgdx.badlogicgames.com/uploads/Screen%20Shot%202016-01-03%20at%2023.14.31-0SrT1qWnRp.png)

And as expected, only 1680x1050 worked, the others showed either a black screen or an incomplete triangle.

This must obviously have something to do with HDPI scaling. I used `GLFW_USE_RETINA` for this build.

Disabling `GLFW_USE_RETINA` does not help:

![http://libgdx.badlogicgames.com/uploads/Screen%20Shot%202016-01-03%20at%2023.20.31-Ow7SNCd1zE.png](http://libgdx.badlogicgames.com/uploads/Screen%20Shot%202016-01-03%20at%2023.20.31-Ow7SNCd1zE.png)

I'd be happy to help any way i can to resolve this issue.
